content.description: A medical researcher is interested in assessing the effectiveness of a new medication for pain relief. Three hundred volunteers will be randomly assigned to groups. One group will receive the new medication at a low dose, one group will receive the new medication at a high dose, and one group will receive a placebo that looks like the new medication but does not contain any active ingredients. Each person will be asked to rate his or her level of pain at the beginning of the experiment and again two hours after taking the medication or placebo.
content.question: What is the number of treatments for this experiment?

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
